item.title: Mirogabalin [Besylate]
item.description: Gabapentinoids are the Vegemite‚Ñ¢ of pharmaceuticals: it’s all love or hate, and almost never in between. If you clicked on this post, you are probably familiar with the fuzzy, electrifying stimulation brought about by an unholy dose of Pregabalin, or the fickle GHB-like lust from scarfing down Phenibut by the tablespoon, or the hassle of leaving CVS with bucket-sized refills of Gabapentin ‚Äì the original gangsta Gabapentinoid. I had assumed that my own first-hand familiarity with the ‘Noids made me well-equipped for my future acquaintance with Tarlige‚Ñ¢ (Mirogabalin Besylate).

item.title: Cyclazodone
Phendimetrazine [Tartrate]
item.description: I‚Äôve had the fortune of running the stimulant gamut, from Adderall to Desoxyn. Going into this experience, I had some comparisons to draw. The literature on this compound was intriguing, but In my skeptical expectations there were no foreseeable surprises. It‚Äôs another stimulant, what‚Äôs the big dealio? Golly gee I was mistaken. Didn‚Äôt even walk 50 feet from the pharmacy before popping one because I‚Äôm an impatient and excitable SOB. Walking to the subway on a chilly northeastern evening, I was hoping the 35mg of obscure stim goodness would warm me up a little.

item.title: Gaboxadol [Hydrochloride]
item.description: Disclaimer: I can’t and don’t recommend Gaboxadol to anyone because it is a narrowly studied substance, and everything I say is just my opinion and not medical advice. Tonight we’re packing 20mg of Gaboxadol HCl in a gelatin cap in hopes of getting some stellar sleep, or I don’t know, a couple' rotating cubes or whatever. I’m cheating a little because this is technically my 2nd trial. The 1st “allergy” trial was done with 10mg down the hatch, about a week ago.
